Sentence: Fever is a physiological response where the body temperature increases.  This rise in temperature is regulated by the hypothalamus.  The hypothalamus sets a higher thermostat setting, triggering the body to generate heat. -[Cause and Effect]- Fever is a mechanism to combat infections.  It is triggered by the release of cytokines by immune cells. -[Cause and Effect]- These cytokines signal the hypothalamus to increase the body's temperature. -[Cause and Effect]- The elevated temperature can inhibit bacterial growth and enhance the activity of immune cells.  Essentially, fever is a part of the immune response.  It helps the body fight off infections more effectively.  This mechanism underscores the body's adaptive strategies to combat illness.  Fever is a common symptom in many illnesses, highlighting its importance in the immune response.
